GT.content: [re: “Counterfeit Money”] only a liar could know whether friend gave real money, that is, a connoisseur of counterfeit money; so narrator believes, credits his friend
GT.linkedContent: [re: “Counterfeit Money”] only a liar could know whether friend gave real money, that is, a connoisseur of counterfeit money; so narrator believes, credits his friend

GT.content: literature as place of non-place of frame, triptych w/ dislocated frame, 3 + or – excluded 4th, all positions exchangeable to infinity, an ex-propriation that forbids a return to self, most powerful or interesting speculation
GT.linkedContent: literature as place of non-place of frame, triptych w/ dislocated frame, 3 + or – excluded 4th, all positions exchangeable to infinity, an ex-propriation that forbids a return to self, most powerful or interesting speculation

GT.content: readers are at once debtors & creditors, like the narrator, we are the beggar, the 3rd party excluded from the secret of the dual scene
GT.linkedContent: readers are at once debtors & creditors, like the narrator, we are the beggar, the 3rd party excluded from the secret of the dual scene

R.content: when democracy is just obscene alibi tolerating suffering, malnutrition, the grossly deprived, those dispossessed of rights (equality, freedom)
R.linkedContent: when democracy is just obscene alibi tolerating suffering, malnutrition, the grossly deprived, those dispossessed of rights (equality, freedom)

AF.content: archive made possible by destruction drive as originary finitude and expropriation, also no archive fever or desire w/out in-finite movement of radical destruction
AF.linkedContent: archive made possible by destruction drive as originary finitude and expropriation, also no archive fever or desire w/out in-finite movement of radical destruction

OOG.content: common object: an object whose original owner is thus dispossessed
OOG.linkedContent: common object: an object whose original owner is thus dispossessed

H.content: “language is also the experience of expropriation, of an irreducible exappropriation” makes us all wandering Jews, mother tongue is the tongue of the other [universalizes election], desert in all of us
H.linkedContent: “language is also the experience of expropriation, of an irreducible exappropriation” makes us all wandering Jews, mother tongue is the tongue of the other [universalizes election], desert in all of us

H.content: p. anne 110 what doesn’t belong to you, highest risk. what you do not possess is what obsesses you
H.linkedContent: p. anne 110 what doesn’t belong to you, highest risk. what you do not possess is what obsesses you

H.content: p. anne 130 what happens when humans are dispossessed of their interiority?
H.linkedContent: p. anne 130 what happens when humans are dispossessed of their interiority?

SPOM.content: exappropriation is the radical contradiction of all “capital,” property and appropriation, as well as ideas that depend on it: i.e. free subjectivity: “servitude binds (itself) to appropriation” > l’exappropriation ne justifie aucune chaîne
SPOM.linkedContent: exappropriation is the radical contradiction of all “capital,” property and appropriation, as well as ideas that depend on it: i.e. free subjectivity: “servitude binds (itself) to appropriation” > l’exappropriation ne justifie aucune chaîne

POOF.content: there are specters on both sides of us (past & future), the phantom friends we lost, the arrival of the Superman > ‘it is necessary to love’ = specters, they are to be loved
POOF.linkedContent: there are specters on both sides of us (past & future), the phantom friends we lost, the arrival of the Superman > ‘it is necessary to love’ = specters, they are to be loved

POOF.content: disjunction of spectral distance marks past/future w/ non-reappropriable alterity [p. 307n cf. Düttmann, “What is Called love in…”]
POOF.linkedContent: disjunction of spectral distance marks past/future w/ non-reappropriable alterity [p. 307n cf. Düttmann, “What is Called love in…”]

MSUBJ.content: “the property of a theme is what an expropriation has deprived us, and it is as if we had been deprived of our own memory, distanced from our own birth”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: “the property of a theme is what an expropriation has deprived us, and it is as if we had been deprived of our own memory, distanced from our own birth”

A.content: “turn what is thus at the very heart of the possibility of the existential analysis against the whole apparatus of Being and Time” > death as most ex-propriating, most inauthenticating
A.linkedContent: “turn what is thus at the very heart of the possibility of the existential analysis against the whole apparatus of Being and Time” > death as most ex-propriating, most inauthenticating

A.content: Heidegger dissociates Verfallen from original sin, but still needs distinction btwn authentic/inauthentic > death as “possibility of impossibility” can mean Eigentlichkeit inhabited by Enteignis
A.linkedContent: Heidegger dissociates Verfallen from original sin, but still needs distinction btwn authentic/inauthentic > death as “possibility of impossibility” can mean Eigentlichkeit inhabited by Enteignis

VM.content: Levinas makes us tremble, from the heart of the desert, a thought which makes us dream of dispossession and dismantling
VM.linkedContent: Levinas makes us tremble, from the heart of the desert, a thought which makes us dream of dispossession and dismantling

PAS.content: event (de-distance of near) (Eriegnis, Entfernung, Enteignis) “before” which philosophy and its pas au déla (thought) are trying to close themselves; event, to come and more than past (à venir et plus que passé) > beyond because the instant I say viens, both pas are crossed in a single pas
PAS.linkedContent: event (de-distance of near) (Eriegnis, Entfernung, Enteignis) “before” which philosophy and its pas au déla (thought) are trying to close themselves; event, to come and more than past (à venir et plus que passé) > beyond because the instant I say viens, both pas are crossed in a single pas

PAS.content: sans remarks same X w/out annulling it, springless spring (ce ressort sans ressort), this re-trait leaves everything intact (sauf, indemne) in appearance [absolute heterogenous neutrality w/out negation], at the same time it has abducted, erased, absolute rapidity of dispossession (dérapage)
PAS.linkedContent: sans remarks same X w/out annulling it, springless spring (ce ressort sans ressort), this re-trait leaves everything intact (sauf, indemne) in appearance [absolute heterogenous neutrality w/out negation], at the same time it has abducted, erased, absolute rapidity of dispossession (dérapage)

PAS.content: faire trembler d’abord (trembling, first approach): denial of fear, frightens more, a fascination, la moindre possibilité de s’arriver, in trembling one renounces mastery, use, domination, one does not know how to sign its effects > pas d’insistance distances itself on first approach
PAS.linkedContent: faire trembler d’abord (trembling, first approach): denial of fear, frightens more, a fascination, la moindre possibilité de s’arriver, in trembling one renounces mastery, use, domination, one does not know how to sign its effects > pas d’insistance distances itself on first approach

PAS.content: to give must forget all the way up to what is given, one gives without having self (sans s’avoir) [see p. (23) say “come” w/out knowing, having, seeing]
PAS.linkedContent: to give must forget all the way up to what is given, one gives without having self (sans s’avoir) [see p. (23) say “come” w/out knowing, having, seeing]

PAS.content: the inner rhythm of sauf (contamination), always altered, always unscathed, “j’ai tout, sauf…” > “sauf que je voudrais en être débarrassé”
PAS.linkedContent: the inner rhythm of sauf (contamination), always altered, always unscathed, “j’ai tout, sauf…” > “sauf que je voudrais en être débarrassé”

VP.content: wouldn’t [contra Husserl] universal element of expressivity forbid fulfillment of Bedeutung when we say “I” in solitude, dispossessing the subject of full intuition of “I”?
VP.linkedContent: wouldn’t [contra Husserl] universal element of expressivity forbid fulfillment of Bedeutung when we say “I” in solitude, dispossessing the subject of full intuition of “I”?

T.content: logic of event, structures of expropriation: timbre (tympanum), style and signature > same obliterating division of the proper, make every event possible, necessary, unfindable
T.linkedContent: logic of event, structures of expropriation: timbre (tympanum), style and signature > same obliterating division of the proper, make every event possible, necessary, unfindable

TC.content: Artaud lived the morrow of a dispossession > his body had been stolen (at birth)—he had to reeducate his organs
TC.linkedContent: Artaud lived the morrow of a dispossession > his body had been stolen (at birth)—he had to reeducate his organs

SH.content: tout autre in Celan, ganz Anderen Sache, other does not contradict, enters into alliance w/, in expropriating, “inmost concern”
SH.linkedContent: tout autre in Celan, ganz Anderen Sache, other does not contradict, enters into alliance w/, in expropriating, “inmost concern”

SH.content: Jewish language, poetic language, this essence promises itself only in dis-identification (in the expropriation of the nothing, non-essence—[ashes?])
SH.linkedContent: Jewish language, poetic language, this essence promises itself only in dis-identification (in the expropriation of the nothing, non-essence—[ashes?])

SP.content: la signature et le texte tombent l’un hors de l’autre, se sécrètent, se séparent, et s’excrètent, se forment de la coupure même qui les décapite, les échafaude en tronc sans tête, dès l’instant de leur itérabilité > expropriative commencement marks everything erected w/ structure of etron [fecal matter]
SP.linkedContent: la signature et le texte tombent l’un hors de l’autre, se sécrètent, se séparent, et s’excrètent, se forment de la coupure même qui les décapite, les échafaude en tronc sans tête, dès l’instant de leur itérabilité > expropriative commencement marks everything erected w/ structure of etron [fecal matter]

PS.content: for Artaud, interpreter already dispossessed of [text] he receives [differance as dispossession]
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, interpreter already dispossessed of [text] he receives [differance as dispossession]

PS.content: for Artaud, furtiveness is quality of dispossession > empties speech before “I” have it: furtive, in Latin, is the manner of a thief, who must act quickly
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, furtiveness is quality of dispossession > empties speech before “I” have it: furtive, in Latin, is the manner of a thief, who must act quickly

PS.content: Artaud’s metaphysics of flesh [MOP?] determines Being as life, its integrity must be restored > a thought governed by anguish of dispossession, my body stolen by the other, by death (as theft): my death is represented
PS.linkedContent: Artaud’s metaphysics of flesh [MOP?] determines Being as life, its integrity must be restored > a thought governed by anguish of dispossession, my body stolen by the other, by death (as theft): my death is represented

PS.content: why does Artaud lament dispossession? > “O! bitches of impossibility”
PS.linkedContent: why does Artaud lament dispossession? > “O! bitches of impossibility”

PS.content: for Artaud, God is false value of initial worth of what is born: this false value becomes Value, for it doubled what never existed > the work (excrement) repeats this theft, steals another part of me [dispossessing my nonexistent ur-value prior to exiting the Orifice]
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, God is false value of initial worth of what is born: this false value becomes Value, for it doubled what never existed > the work (excrement) repeats this theft, steals another part of me [dispossessing my nonexistent ur-value prior to exiting the Orifice]

PS.content: for Artaud, “the metaphor of myself is my dispossession w/in language” > this by way of the counterfeiter, God–Satan, who isn’t a creator, but the subject of all [dispossessing] oeuvres
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, “the metaphor of myself is my dispossession w/in language” > this by way of the counterfeiter, God–Satan, who isn’t a creator, but the subject of all [dispossessing] oeuvres

PS.content: acc. Artaud, membering is dismembering; structure always structure of expropriation; “every organ is a parasite” of the body, the body has no need of organs; Heart: “dirtiest means that any being could have invented to pump life inside me” > Artaud as fearful of articulated body as articulated language
PS.linkedContent: acc. Artaud, membering is dismembering; structure always structure of expropriation; “every organ is a parasite” of the body, the body has no need of organs; Heart: “dirtiest means that any being could have invented to pump life inside me” > Artaud as fearful of articulated body as articulated language

DIF.content: differance not a process of propriation, neither “species” of genus Being nor Ereignis (nor ontological difference): neither appropriation (position), nor expropriation (negation)—it is other
DIF.linkedContent: differance not a process of propriation, neither “species” of genus Being nor Ereignis (nor ontological difference): neither appropriation (position), nor expropriation (negation)—it is other

REST.content: affect of Van Gogh’s painting: army of ghosts demanding their shoes, bottomless memory of a dispossession
REST.linkedContent: affect of Van Gogh’s painting: army of ghosts demanding their shoes, bottomless memory of a dispossession

REST.content: can a ghost (fantôme) be attributed as “the ghost-of”? > no distributive justice for this tribute: shoes always open to unconscious of the other, never possessed, still less kept (garder)
REST.linkedContent: can a ghost (fantôme) be attributed as “the ghost-of”? > no distributive justice for this tribute: shoes always open to unconscious of the other, never possessed, still less kept (garder)

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: désistance as a desertion [Derrida quotes a passage w/out usage of désistance] that is prior to any ‘self-possession’ (not mode of dispossession), (de)constitution of subject, can one think of loss re: what one never had?
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: désistance as a desertion [Derrida quotes a passage w/out usage of désistance] that is prior to any ‘self-possession’ (not mode of dispossession), (de)constitution of subject, can one think of loss re: what one never had?

TR.content: de Man: dispossession in writing due to arbitrary power of signifier, from point of view of subject, this can only be experienced as beheading, dismemberment, castration
TR.linkedContent: de Man: dispossession in writing due to arbitrary power of signifier, from point of view of subject, this can only be experienced as beheading, dismemberment, castration

TR.content: [re: event, trauma] that which makes possible desire, some outside, some nondesire, some death: becoming possible of the impossible as im-possible (inappropriability of the other)
TR.linkedContent: [re: event, trauma] that which makes possible desire, some outside, some nondesire, some death: becoming possible of the impossible as im-possible (inappropriability of the other)

AFR.content: another disappropriation, fission, in 2 concepts of imagination, tampers w/ very concept of what disappropriates [re: Condillac]: 1. imagination as purely reproductive: disposition, material used by consciousness, perception 2. imagination as productive: force, free > new forms can be true or untrue (in order to supply, it adds something more)
AFR.linkedContent: another disappropriation, fission, in 2 concepts of imagination, tampers w/ very concept of what disappropriates [re: Condillac]: 1. imagination as purely reproductive: disposition, material used by consciousness, perception 2. imagination as productive: force, free > new forms can be true or untrue (in order to supply, it adds something more)

D.content: le discurs d’assistance, pluperfect, deconstructs “illusion” of present, unites presence & auxiliary, supports [Plato’s boetheia] ekgonos (dispossessed son), a seed exposed to all violence of writing: you [baby daddy]
D.linkedContent: le discurs d’assistance, pluperfect, deconstructs “illusion” of present, unites presence & auxiliary, supports [Plato’s boetheia] ekgonos (dispossessed son), a seed exposed to all violence of writing: you [baby daddy]

D.content: imperfect, certain aorist, certain unlimitedness, “unreachable double bottom (double-fond insaisissable)”: past of an anterior future, future of an anterior past
D.linkedContent: imperfect, certain aorist, certain unlimitedness, “unreachable double bottom (double-fond insaisissable)”: past of an anterior future, future of an anterior past

D.content: “I” as surface vacant of itself: foments (prepares a poison) cruel dispossession > reaches simulacrum point: où il peut à la fois teindre le tissu (stains the tissue) et feindre to tell you truth about it
D.linkedContent: “I” as surface vacant of itself: foments (prepares a poison) cruel dispossession > reaches simulacrum point: où il peut à la fois teindre le tissu (stains the tissue) et feindre to tell you truth about it

LI.content: deconstructions are movements of “exappropriation” > is a system (i.e. university) that appropriates it (i.e. deconstructive style) modified by this appropriation?
LI.linkedContent: deconstructions are movements of “exappropriation” > is a system (i.e. university) that appropriates it (i.e. deconstructive style) modified by this appropriation?

TN.content: contamination becomes what it is not: disidentifies/disappropriates everything before it disidentifies itself > attains the ex-propriety of the proper
TN.linkedContent: contamination becomes what it is not: disidentifies/disappropriates everything before it disidentifies itself > attains the ex-propriety of the proper

TN.content: for Levinas, the peace that is ethical found more in the tender caress that renounces possession than in erotic violence acharnée à jouir
TN.linkedContent: for Levinas, the peace that is ethical found more in the tender caress that renounces possession than in erotic violence acharnée à jouir

TN.content: it’s because there’s some technical (which there is not) that one can infinitely repeat examples that deconstruct very properness/unity itself of all essences, “beings”
TN.linkedContent: it’s because there’s some technical (which there is not) that one can infinitely repeat examples that deconstruct very properness/unity itself of all essences, “beings”

ATM.content: Levinas: the other can always dispossess me of my work
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas: the other can always dispossess me of my work

EW.content: via “logic” of trace or differance, re-appropriation produces the opposite of what it aims for, thus ex-appropriation is not what is proper to man
EW.linkedContent: via “logic” of trace or differance, re-appropriation produces the opposite of what it aims for, thus ex-appropriation is not what is proper to man

EW.content: ex-appropriation does not form a boundary (a closure or a negativity), never totalizes itself, irreducibility of relation to other
EW.linkedContent: ex-appropriation does not form a boundary (a closure or a negativity), never totalizes itself, irreducibility of relation to other

AD.content: host is guest in own home, one who receives is received in receiving: Rosenzweig’s originary dispossession of ipseity, home [the Jew]
AD.linkedContent: host is guest in own home, one who receives is received in receiving: Rosenzweig’s originary dispossession of ipseity, home [the Jew]

AD.content: ex-propriety makes of the subject a hôte and hostage (gentle), someone who is in his own home in the home of the other—“anachronism of a debt preceding the loan”
AD.linkedContent: ex-propriety makes of the subject a hôte and hostage (gentle), someone who is in his own home in the home of the other—“anachronism of a debt preceding the loan”

BSi.content: treatment, curiosity, autopsy: expropriating the other

OG.content: dispossession institutes/deconstitutes me (is a law of language)—dessaisissement spéculaire, power of death at heart of living speech > dispossessed of longed-for presence in attempt to seize it [Rousseau recognized this]
OG.linkedContent: dispossession institutes/deconstitutes me (is a law of language)—dessaisissement spéculaire, power of death at heart of living speech > dispossessed of longed-for presence in attempt to seize it [Rousseau recognized this]

OG.content: Rousseau’s sacrifice: never began to live until he looked upon himself as a dead man, until he affirmed writing [death in life, differance] > aiming at a symbolic reappropriation of presence that differance will have breached/broached
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau’s sacrifice: never began to live until he looked upon himself as a dead man, until he affirmed writing [death in life, differance] > aiming at a symbolic reappropriation of presence that differance will have breached/broached

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] writing: 1) effort to symbolically reappropriate presence 2) consecrates dispossession that had already dislocated parole
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] writing: 1) effort to symbolically reappropriate presence 2) consecrates dispossession that had already dislocated parole

OG.content: acc. Heidegger’s history of metaphysics, liberty/truth became condition of presence: freedom of speech borrows no signifiers from exterior world—cannot be dispossessed
OG.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger’s history of metaphysics, liberty/truth became condition of presence: freedom of speech borrows no signifiers from exterior world—cannot be dispossessed

OG.content: image is death, it cannot represent & add representer to represented, thus presence of re-presented folded back on itself in the world, presence announces its dispossession w/in its own representer/death > subject: merely this movement of expropriation
OG.linkedContent: image is death, it cannot represent & add representer to represented, thus presence of re-presented folded back on itself in the world, presence announces its dispossession w/in its own representer/death > subject: merely this movement of expropriation

OG.content: representation dispossesses, re-presents, wrenches presence from itself
naiveté of MOP: to see representation as restorative
OG.linkedContent: naiveté of MOP: to see representation as restorative

SPEC.content: PP as quasi-proper, figure of mastery, exappropriation structures PP,  proper produced as autothanatography
SPEC.linkedContent: PP as quasi-proper, figure of mastery, exappropriation structures PP, proper produced as autothanatography

FV.content: signer dispossessed [re: The Purloined…], signature in quotations: ce reste est encore de la littérature
FV.linkedContent: signer dispossessed [re: The Purloined…], signature in quotations: ce reste est encore de la littérature
